intro: Tithymalus mucronulatus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. Tithymalus mucronulatus is native to regions of southern Africa and is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
